articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration has directed U.S. prosecutors to criminally investigate state and local officials who attempt to resist its immigration enforcement efforts, according to a memo to Justice Department staff seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Trump administration to criminally probe officials who resist immigration actions

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The Trump administration is discussing a 10% punitive duty on Chinese imports. Trump said the EU also has troubling trade surpluses with the United States.
articles.title: Trump stirs tariff pot with fresh threats on EU, Feb 1 China deadline

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: Guns may have fallen silent in Gaza, but for Mahmoud Abu Dalfa, the agony is not over. He is desperately searching for the bodies of his wife and five children trapped under the rubble of his house since the early months of the war.
articles.title: Bereaved Gazans dig out bodies from city ruins, give them graves

articles.author: Laura Gottesdiener, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Mexican authorities have begun constructing giant tent shelters in the city of Ciudad Juarez to prepare for a possible influx of Mexicans deported under U.S. President Donald Trump's promised mass deportations.
articles.title: Mexico builds temporary shelters to prepare for mass deportations from U.S.

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: He hails a fantastic woman sweeping all before her in Europe. She praises a strong and shrewd defender of the West. Donald Trump and Giorgia Meloni are fast forging a new transatlantic "special relationship".
articles.title: Trump whisperer? Italy's Meloni navigates a high-stakes relationship

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: In neighbourhoods levelled by 15 months of war with Israel, Hamas officials are overseeing the clearance of rubble in the wake of Sunday's ceasefire. The group's gunmen are guarding aid convoys on Gaza's dusty roads, and its blue-uniformed police once again patrol city streets, sending a clear message: Hamas remains in charge.
articles.title: Hamas' tight grip on Gaza complicates plan for lasting peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The M23 rebel group in Democratic Republic of Congo has seized the eastern town of Minova, a main supply route for the provincial capital Goma, a local governor and a rebel leader said on Tuesday as the army reported fighting on all fronts.
articles.title: Congo rebels seize eastern town on critical supply route

articles.author: Michael Holden, Sam Tobin
articles.description: Prince Harry claimed a "monumental" victory over Rupert Murdoch's UK newspaper group on Wednesday after the publisher settled his lawsuit, admitting unlawful actions at its Sun tabloid for the first time and paying substantial damages.
articles.title: Prince Harry hails 'monumental' legal win over Murdoch newspapers

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: An executive order by U.S. President Donald Trump to suspend refugee admissions has magnified the fears of one Afghan American soldier who has long been worried about the fate of his sister in Kabul.
articles.title: Afghan Americans fearful after Trump order halts refugee program

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Michael Martina, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: Trump faces a challenge: US foes have become more unified following Russia's invasion of Ukraine
articles.title: Aiming to weaken US foes, Trump faces an 'unholy alliance'
